newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Philippines in no hurry over Yankee bond -Singson.
newsitem.headline: Philippines in no hurry over Yankee bond -Singson.

text.p: The Philippines is no hurry to launch its US$1.25 billion Yankee bond but is prepared to act quickly if market conditions warrant, Philippine Central Bank Governor Gabriel Singson said in Hong Kong on Thursday.
"This is really a judgment call and we have to decide on a daily basis. Ultimately I have the luxury of time. I'm not in any hurry," he said.
Singson said the Philippines could go back to the market very quickly because its registration and roadshow were complete.
He said Manila was closely monitoring U.S. rates following Tuesday's decision by the U.S. Federal Open Market Committee to leave rates unchanged.
Singson said that when the Philippines decided in February to launch a Yankee bond, the U.S. benchmark long bond yield was between 6.50 and 6.60 percent for a spread of about 160 basis points.
"Our underwriters tell us we can go back to the market very quickly," he said.
